column3:
The rationale for removing the predecessor was that (maybe) people
were confused which clang format script is meant for day-to-day dev
activity, so they used none. Lets hope this changes after we had the
discussion in last weeks meeting and after deleting the unused script.
So there is only one script left with a description on how to use it.
Though, I am not interested in enforcing the use o

I support keeping `devtools/` uncluttered for things that are clearly needed to be understood by everyone, so I am on board with it not going there at present time.\n\nIn the long run, my hope would be that every code-changing PR gets massaged developer-side prior to submission and everyone does a clean TravisCI run on the branch in their forked repo prior to submitting the PR. An efficient work

Please add scripts like this to the maintainer tools: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools\n\nThere are meta-tools that are not part of the Bitcoin Core release schedule and branching, so have no place in the repository. `qa/devtools` could be seen as a historical error in that regard, but we'll keep some often-used scripts there.

> In the long run, my hope would be that every code-changing PR gets massaged developer-side prior to submission and everyone does a clean TravisCI run on the branch in their forked repo prior to submitting the PR.

Sure, I completely agree that in the future, if it gets used by every developer it can be moved to somewhere inside the tree if that is more convenient.
